contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=May 2011}} '''Antonius Philippus René Laanen''' (born 23 January 1952) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[trombone|bass trombonist]].{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} Born in [[The Hague]], Laanen's father [[Theo Laanen|Theo]] was also a noted trombonist. After training in the [[Royal Conservatory]], he worked in the 1960s and early 1970s as a freelance trombonist in [[Germany]] and his home country.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} In 1972 he founded the Hague Trombone Quartet with [[Arthur Moore (musician)|Arthur Moore]] and the brothers [[Bart van Lier|Bart]] and [[Erik van Lier]]. In 1980 he played with the [[Pretoria Symphony Orchestra]] in [[Johannesburg]], [[South Africa]].{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} In the 1990s he worked as a music [[copyist]] for the famous [[Metropole Orchestra]].{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} He also runs a web site "Trombone Page of the world".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=MWSB&p_theme=mwsb&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EB82DB4ECFC8D3C&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM|title=The trombone hits some high notes on the Web|date=11 April 2000|work=[[Milwaukee Journal Sentinel]]|accessdate=27 May 2011}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.renelaanen.com/ René Laanen's web site] * [http://www.trombone-usa.com/ René Laanen's Trombone Page of the world] * [http://www.jazzmasters.nl/ René Laanen's Jazz Masters] {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Laanen, Rene | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Dutch musician | DATE OF BIRTH = 23 January 1952 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Laanen, Rene}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dutch classical trombonists]] [[Category:People from The Hague]] {{Netherlands-classical-musician-stub}} {{trombonist-stub}}
